intro: Dimeria glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This perennial herb is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
